intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris serrata, commonly known as the common chickweed or mouse-ear chickweed, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with alternate, ovate leaves that have serrated edges. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens, fields, and along roadsides. Its rapid growth and prolific seed production make it a common weed in many regions.
